column1: Book Information: "Save this information for next time" checkbox is disabled in the Contact Information form
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]

 # Navigate to the Sessions module

 # Click Book Now and proceed through the booking steps

 # On the Contact Information form in the Session Information page, locate the "Save this information for next time" checkbox

*Actual Result:* "Save this information for next time" checkbox is disabled in the Contact Information form - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 110310.png]

*Expected result:* According to the documentation, the checkbox should be enabled by ** default, allowing the user to select it. When selected, the user's contact information should be saved for future bookings - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 110540.png]

column1: Book Information: "Keep me up to date on news" checkbox is checked by default in the Contact Information form
column27:
*Steps:* 
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]

 # Navigate to the Sessions module

 # Click Book Now and proceed through the booking process

 # On the Contact Information form in the Book Information page, locate the "Keep me up to date on news" checkbox - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 110310.png]

*Actual result:* "Keep me up to date on news" checkbox is checked by default in the Contact Information 

*Expected result:* As per the documentation, the "Keep me up to date on news" checkbox should be unchecked by default on the Contact Information form - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 105530.png]

column1: Book Information: Mini Outdoor and Standard session photos appear in each other’s positions in the session information section
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]

 # Navigate to the Sessions module

 # Click Book Now for both Mini Outdoor and Standard sessions separately

 # Navigate to the Booking Information page

 # Observe the photo displayed under Session Information -see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 103751.png] &  [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 103635.png]

*Actual result:* Mini Outdoor and Standard session photos appear in each other’s positions in the session information section

*Expected result:* Each session should display its correct photo in the ** Session Information section, as specified in the documentation - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 104725.png] & [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 104702.png]

column1: Standard Session: The total session cost is calculated using $250 as the base fee for the Standard Session instead of $650
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]

 # Navigate to the Sessions module

 # Click the Book Now button for the Standard Session

 # Proceed with booking by selecting options and clicking Book button

 # Observe the calculated Total Amount in the Booking Information page

*Actual result:* The total session cost is calculated using $250 as the base fee for the Standard Session instead of $650 - see here [^Video 2025-05-05 10.32.49.mp4]

*Expected result:* The total session cost should be calculated based on the correct base session fee of $650 for the Standard Session, as specified in the documentation - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 083409.png]

column1: Standard Session: The Additional Subjects dropdown displays only 7 options (1 to 7) instead of 10
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]

 # Navigate to the Sessions module

 # Click the Book Now button for the Standard Session

 # Open the Additional Subjects dropdown

 # Count the number of available options - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 102140.png]

*Actual Result:* The Additional Subjects dropdown displays only 7 options (1 to 7) instead of 10 

*Expected Result:* The Additional Subjects dropdown should display 10 options, as specified in the documentation

column1: Book Session: Standard Session fee displayed as $250 instead of $650 as specified
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]

 # Navigate to the Sessions module

 # Click on the Book Now button and enter the Standard Session

 # Pay attention to the Book Session page, where the Booking Amount is shown - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 081827.png]

*Actual result:* Standard Session fee displayed as $250 instead of $650 as specified

*Expected result:* The session fee for the Standard Session on the Book Session page should be displayed as $650, as specified in the documentation - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 083409.png]

column1: Book Session: Additional Subjects Add $50 per Person Instead of $55 as Specified while booking the Mini Studio session
column27:
*Steps :*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]

 # Navigate to the Sessions module

 # Click on the Book Now button and enter the Mini Studio Session

 # Try to select any value from the Additional Subjects dropdown

 # Click the Book button and navigate to the Book Information page

 # Pay attention to the session information where the Total Calculated Amount is shown - see here  [^Video 2025-05-05 08.12.39.mp4]

*Actual result: Book Session:* Additional Subjects Add $50 per Person Instead of $55 as specified while booking the Mini Studio session

*Expected result:* Each additional subject should add $55 to the session fee as specified. The total amount should be calculated accordingly - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 081212.png]

column1: Mini Studio Session: "Option 6" Appears Disabled in Additional Subjects Dropdown
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to the Sessions module
 # Click on the Book Now button and enter the Mini Studio Session
 # Try to select option 6 from the Additional Subjects dropdown
 # Pay attention to the response - see here [^Video 2025-05-05 07.35.42.mp4]

*Actual result:* "Option 6" Appears Disabled in the Additional Subjects Dropdown

Expected result: 

*Expected Result:* All options, including "Option 6" should be selectable in the dropdown list

column1: Session Module: The search bar appears with an altered shape after navigating the Mini Studio, Mini Outdoor, and Standard session pages
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to the Sessions module
 # Click on the Book Now button and enter the Mini Studio, Mini Outdoor, and Standard Session
 # Notice the UI change in the search bar in the top-right corner - see here [^Video 2025-05-05 02.49.41.mp4]

*Actual result:* The search bar appears with an altered shape after navigating the Mini Studio, Mini Outdoor, and Standard sessions pages

*Expected result:* The search bar UI should remain visually consistent across all pages, including the Contact page

column1: Session Module: "Book Now" Is a Hyperlink Instead of a Button in the Mini Studio, Mini Outdoor, and Standard Session
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to the Sessions module
 # Using Dev Tool, inspect the "Book Now" option for all three session types - see here [^Video 2025-05-05 02.05.02.mp4]

*Actual result:* "Book Now" Is a Hyperlink Instead of a Button in the Mini Studio, Mini Outdoor, and Standard Session - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 020343.png]

*Expected result:* "Book Now" should be displayed as a button, as specified in the documentation - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 015819.png], [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 015914.png] & [^Screenshot 2025-05-05 015954.png]

column1: Session module: The footer section is disappearing while entering any of the session pages
column27:
*Steps:* 
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to the Session module
 # Click on the Book Now button and enter the Mini Studio, Mini Outdoor, and Standard Session
 # Observe that the footer is no longer visible or accessible - see here [^Video 2025-05-05 01.52.42.mp4]

*Actual result:* The footer section is disappearing while entering any of the session pages

*Expected result:* Entering the Session pages should not affect the visibility of other sections, including the footer

column1: Gallery: Some random photos are missing the expand button to see the full-size view
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to the session module and enter any of the galleries
 # Click on an image and try to expand it into full-size view
 # Observe whether there is an expand button to see the expanded view

**

*Actual result:* Some random photos are missing the expand button to see the full-size view - see here [^Video 2025-05-05 01.28.27.mp4]

**

*Expected Result:* Every image in the gallery should have a ** consistent expand button, allowing users to enlarge and preview them properly

column1: Gallery: No dedicated close button is available to close the full-size view of an image
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to the session module and enter any of the galleries
 # Click on an image and expand it into full-size view
 # Observe whether there is a close button to exit the expanded view

*Actual result:* No dedicated close button is available to close the full-size view of an image - see here [^Video 2025-05-05 01.13.43.mp4]

*Expected result:*  There should be a dedicated close button to allow users to exit full-screen mode intuitively

column1: Contact page: The search bar appears with altered shape after navigating this page
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Observe the search bar styling on the Home page.

 # Navigate to Connect > Contact page.

 # Notice the UI change in the search bar in the top-right corner - see here [^image-2025-05-05-00-42-10-419.png]

*Actual result:* The search bar appears with an altered shape after navigating the contact page - see here [^Video 2025-05-05 00.43.08.mp4]

*Expected result:* The search bar UI should remain visually consistent across all pages, including the Contact page

column1: Contact Form: Custom required messages are not shown for obligatory fields when left blank; instead, "Please fill in this field." is displayed
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to Connect → Contact Form
 # Leave the following fields empty and try to submit the form

*Actual result:* Contact Form: Custom required messages are not shown for obligatory fields when left blank; instead, "Please fill in this field." is displayed - see here [^Video 2025-05-05 00.04.38.mp4]

*Expected result:* As per the documentation, the following custom error messages should be displayed:
 * *Firstname:* "Firstname is required."

 * *Lastname:* "Lastname is required."

 * *Email:* "Valid email is required."

 * *Subject:* "Subject is required."

 * *Message:* "Please leave me a message."

See here - [^Screenshot 2025-05-04 234524.png]

column1: Contact Form: Firstname, Lastname, Subject, and Message fields allow special characters, though documentation specifies alpha-only input
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to Connect → Contact Form

 # In the form, enter special characters (e.g., {{{}@{}}}, {{{}#{}}}, {{{}${}}}, etc.) in Firstname, Lastname, Subject, and Message fields:

 # Pay attention to the input fields

*Actual result:* Firstname, Lastname, Subject, and Message fields allow special characters, though documentation specifies alpha-only input - see here [^Video 2025-05-04 23.05.55.mp4]

*Expected result:* These fields should only accept alphabetical characters (alpha type) and reject special characters as per the documentation - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-04 230157.png]

column1: Contact Form: “Last Name” field accepts only 8 characters instead of 48 as required
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to Connect → Contact Form

 # Locate the Last Name field

 # Try entering more than 8 characters 

*Actual result:* “Last Name” field accepts only 8 characters instead of 48 as required - see here [^Video 2025-05-04 14.31.45.mp4]

*Expected result:* The Message field should allow up to 48 characters as defined in the documentation - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-04 142704.png]

column1: Contact Form: “Message” field accepts only 300 characters instead of 2048 as required
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to Connect → Contact Form

 # Locate the Message field

 # Try entering more than 300 characters

*Actual result:* “Message” field accepts only 300 characters instead of 2048 as required - see here [^Video 2025-05-04 13.42.50.mp4]

*Expected result:* The Message field should allow up to 2048 characters as defined in the documentation - see here [^Requirement_30.png]

column1: Contact Form: 'First Name' field allows empty submission without showing the required error message
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to Connect → Contact
 # Leave the First Name field empty

 # Attempt to submit the form
 # Observe the response 

*Actual result:* 'First Name' field allows empty submission without showing required error message despite being specified in the documentation - see here [^Video 2025-05-03 17.20.25.mp4]

*Expected result:* If the First Name field is left empty, an error message "First name is required" should be shown, preventing submission - see here [^Requirement_29.png]

column1: Connect Tab: Clicking the Contact Menu causes the footer to disappear
column27:

 # Observe that the footer is no longer visible or accessible - see here [^Video 2025-05-03 16.46.58.mp4]

*Actual result:* Clicking the Contact Menu causes the footer to disappear

*Expected result:* Clicking the Contact menu should not affect the visibility of other sections, including the footer

column1: Clients section: Alex Ching photo redirects to Maclaren website link while clicking
column27:

 # Navigate to Connect → Clients

 # Observe the content displayed on the page - see here [^Video 2025-05-03 12.44.23.mp4]

*Actual result:* Alex Ching photo redirects to Maclaren website link while clicking, which is [http://www.maclarenbaby.com/], but should not have any link as specified - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-03 115431.png] & [^Screenshot 2025-05-03 115614.png]

*Expected result:* Clicking Alex Ching should redirect to any website, as it doesn’t have any profile link - see here [^Requirement_25.png]

 # Pay attention to the response 

*Actual result:* Photos without profile links still trigger page reload on click - see here [^Video 2025-05-03 03.13.06.mp4]

*Expected result:* Photos without profile links should not trigger any action or page reload when clicked - see here [^Requirement_23.png]

*Actual result:* “Laser Performance” and “MAM” customers are not listed on the webpage, while they are specified in the documentation - see here [^Video 2025-05-03 02.17.04.mp4]

column1: Portrait gallery: Image positions swapped on page 3 compared to the documentation
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to the Work tab

 # Click on Portrait to open the Portrait Gallery

 # Go to Page 3 of the gallery

 # Compare the image sequence with the provided documentation 

*Actual result:* Image positions swapped on page 3 compared to the documentation - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-02 054839.png]

*Expected result:* All images should appear in the correct sequence and position as specified in the documentation - see here [^Requirement_11.png]

column1: Gallery preview: Page enters an unlimited loading state after clicking multiple times on a preview photo
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to the “Work” tab and open any gallery (e.g., Portrait, Lifestyle)

 # Click on a preview photo to open it in full view

 # Repeatedly click the same preview photo multiple times in quick succession

 # Observe the application’s response - see here [^Video 2025-05-01 20.55.31.mp4]

*Actual result:* The page enters an unlimited loading state after clicking multiple times on a preview photo, and the user cannot interact with it unless a manual refresh is performed

*Expected result:* Clicking on a preview photo should open it once. Repeated clicks should not freeze or break the page, and the gallery should remain fully functional

column1: Lifestyle gallery (Page 5): Preview photo view missing tooltip and expected interaction behavior while viewing
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to Work → Lifestyle

 # Go to Page 5 of the gallery

 # Click on any preview photo

*Actual result:* Preview photo view missing tooltip and expected interaction behavior at page 5 while viewing - see here [^Video 2025-05-02 01.55.43.mp4]

*Expected result:* All preview photos should display a tooltip with the photo number, and clicking should open a clear, interactive preview area showing all photos from the current page - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-02 034359.png]

column1: Lifestyle gallery: Image 7 on page 5 fails to load and shows an error pop-up when trying to open

 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to Work → Lifestyle Gallery  

 # Go to page 5 

 # Click on image 7 

*Actual result:* Image 7 on page 5 fails to load and shows an error pop-up when trying to open - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-02 003347.png]

*Expected result:* Image 7 should open in preview without error and display correctly

column1: Gallery Preview: A cross button appears in the bottom-right corner, and back/next buttons appear in the center of the screen; those are not specified while hovering
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to Work → Open any gallery

 # Click on an image to open the preview

 # Observe the cross, back, and next buttons - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-01 195602.png], [^Screenshot 2025-05-01 202508.png], [^Screenshot 2025-05-01 203709.png]

*Actual result:* A cross button appears in the bottom-right corner, and back/next buttons appear in the center of the screen; those are not specified while hovering - see here [^Video 2025-05-01 20.37.44.mp4]

*Expected result:* Only buttons mentioned in the specification should be present, and their positions should follow the documented layout - see here [^Requirement_9.png]

column1: Image Preview: The labels of the Back and Next buttons are not clear while hovering
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Go to Work → Open any gallery (e.g., Portrait)

 # Click on a photo to open the preview modal

 # Observe the Back and Next buttons 

*Actual result:* Image Preview: The labels of the Back and Next buttons are not clear while hovering - see here [^Video 2025-05-01 19.56.47.mp4] and [^Screenshot 2025-05-01 195602.png]

*Expected result:* The Back and Next buttons should have clear labels to indicate navigation direction effectively

*Additional information:* This issue is present across all gallery sections throughout the website

column1: Portrait gallery: “Next” button navigates incorrectly from page 3 to page 2 instead of page 4
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Hover over Work → Click on Portrait Gallery

 # Navigate to page 3 using the pagination buttons

 # Click the Next button

*Actual result:* “Next” button navigates incorrectly from page 3 to page 2 instead of page 4 - see here [^Video 2025-05-01 19.40.09.mp4] 

*Expected result:* Clicking Next on page 3 should take the user to page 4
column145: 01/May/25 4:45 PM;m13.hasan;*Correction of the Title:* Portrait gallery: “Next” button navigates from page 3 to page 2 instead of page 4;;;

column1: Work submenu: Gallery image sizes do not match specified dimensions
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Hover over the Work tab and open each gallery (Portrait, Lifestyle, Travel, Motion)

 # Inspect the images inside the galleries, and the Images are rendered at 224.6px × 129.6px - see here [^Recording 2025-05-01 192301.mp4]

*Actual result:* Gallery image sizes do not match the specified dimensions - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-01 185958.png]

*Expected result:* Each gallery image should be exactly 225px × 130px as specified - see here [^Requirement_8.0.png], [^Requirement_8.1.png] and [Requirement_8.2.png]
column145: 01/May/25 4:28 PM;m13.hasan;See here the last snapshot of the expected result [^Requirement_8.2.png];;;

column1: Page Title: It is displayed in all capital letters instead of proper title case as specified
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Observe the page titles displayed at the top

 # Notice that all page titles appear in ALL CAPS instead of following proper title case formatting - see here [^Video 2025-05-01 18.38.08.mp4]

*Actual result:* It is displayed in all capital letters instead of proper title case as specified

*Expected result:* Page titles should be formatted using Title Case (e.g., Portrait Gallery instead of PORTRAIT GALLERY) - see here [^Requirement_7.png], [^Requirement_7.1.png], [^Requirement_7.2.png]

*Additional information:* This issue is present all over the pages in every section

column1: Home page: Does not navigate to the corresponding gallery when clicking the preview photos
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Scroll to the Demo section on the Home page

 # Click on any of the preview images - see here [^Video 2025-05-01 15.06.19.mp4]

*Actual result:* In home page does not navigate to the corresponding gallery when clicking the preview photos

*Expected result:* Clicking a preview photo should better to redirect to the corresponding gallery page (e.g., Portrait Gallery, Lifestyle Gallery, etc.) - see here [^Requirement_6.png]

column1: Connect Tab: Clicking the Contact Menu causes the sessions tab to disappear
column27:
*Steps:* 
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to the Connect tab{*}{*} 
 # Click on the Contact menu option from dropdown

 # Observe that the Sessions tab is no longer visible or accessible - see here [^Video 2025-05-01 12.24.30.mp4]
** 

*Actual result:* Connect Tab: Clicking the Contact Menu causes the sessions tab to disappear

*Expected result:* Clicking the Contact menu should not affect the visibility of other tabs, including the Sessions tab

**

column1: Work Tab: 'Motion' Submenu is not accessible from the menu dropdown
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to the work tab 
 # From the dropdown try to access the Motion tab
 # Pay attention to the response - see here [^Video 2025-05-01 12.19.16.mp4]

*Actual result:* 'Motion' Submenu is not accessible from the menu dropdown

*Expected result:* Clicking on "Motion" should navigate to the corresponding gallery

column1: Responsive UI: Page elements do not adjust correctly on zoom, causing content to disappear at 175%
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Navigate to the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/] 

 # Increase the browser zoom level to 175%

 # Observe the layout and positioning of the UI elements - see here [^Recording 2025-05-01 115911.mp4]

*Actual result:* Page elements do not adjust correctly on zoom, causing content to disappear at 175%

*Expected result:* All UI elements should responsively adjust their positions and sizes according to the zoom level, ensuring no content overlaps, disappears, or becomes inaccessible

column1: Work section: “Gallery” label missing in dropdown menu items as specified in documentation
column27:
*Steps:* 
 # Navigate to the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Click on the Work tab from the top navigation

 # Observe the contents of the page - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-01 111805.png]

*Actual result:* “Gallery” label missing in dropdown menu items as specified in documentation

*Expected result:* Each dropdown menu item should include the word “Gallery” as per the specification: see here [^Requirement_5.png]
 * Portrait Gallery

 * Lifestyle Gallery

 * Travel Gallery

 * Motion Gallery

column1: Search functionality: The page reloads briefly, but no output or feedback is presented to the user when searching
column27:
*Steps:* 
 # Navigate to [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]

 # Locate the search bar at the top-right corner

 # Enter any valid keyword (e.g., "session", "work", "Gregory")

 # Press Enter or click the Search button

*Actual result:* The page reloads briefly, but no output or feedback is presented to the user when searching - see here [^Video 2025-05-01 11.06.08.mp4]

*Expected result:* The search functionality should retrieve and display relevant results

column1: Footer section: Twitter URL contains "www" prefix that differs from the specification
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Scroll down to the footer section

 # Observe the Twitter link displayed as: www.twitter.com/ph_olsen

 # Compare it with the project specification, where the expected format is: twitter.com/ph_olsen (without the "www" prefix) - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-01 061935-1.png]

*Actual result:* Twitter URL contains "www" prefix that differs from the specification

*Expected result:* Twitter URL should be consistent as specified in the documentation - see here [^Requirement_4-2.png]

column1: Search field: Accepts more than 300 characters without giving any validation message while searching
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Locate the search bar in the top navigation menu

 # Input more than 300 characters (e.g., paste a long string of random text)

 # Observe the field behavior

*Actual result:* Accepts more than 300 characters without giving any validation message while searching - see here [^Video 2025-05-01 05.19.06.mp4]

*Expected result:* The search field should restrict input to 300 characters, preventing excessive entry beyond the defined limit

column1: Search field: Accepts special characters, despite English letters and numbers, while searching
column27:
*Steps:* 
 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Locate the search bar in the top navigation menu

 # Enter a string containing special characters (e.g., %&@^(!#{{{}){}}}

 # Observe the behavior, is it giving any validation message or not{*}{*}

*Actual result:* Accepts special characters, despite English letters and numbers, while searching - see here [^Video 2025-05-01 05.19.06.mp4]

*Expected result:* The search field should only accept English letters and numbers, per the defined criteria

column1: Navigation menu: “Connect” and “Sessions” positions do not follow the documented sequence
column27:

 # Open the application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # locate the ** navigation menu at the top

 # Check the sequence of the menu items - see here [^Screenshot 2025-05-01 004633.png]

*Actual result:* “Connect” and “Sessions” positions do not follow the documented sequence

*Expected result:* Navigation menu should follow the order:
Home → Work → Connect → Sessions → Instaolsen - see here [^Requirement_3.png]

column1: Footer section: The last two digits of the mobile number are different from the documentation
column27:

 # Open the application: https://photostudio.demohoster.com/

 # Scroll to the Footer section

 # Observe the mobile phone number displayed

*Actual result:* The last two digits of the mobile number are different from the documentation

*Expected result:* The mobile number in the footer should exactly match the number specified in the documentation - see here [^Requirement_2.png]

column1: Header Section: In home icon camera logo is specified in the documentation, but is missing from the website
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Application: [https://photostudio.demohoster.com/]
 # Navigate to the header section

 # Observe that the camera logo, which is present with Gregory Olsen name in the documentation, does it showing in the actual website - see here [^Screenshot 2025-04-30 224139.png]

*Actual result:* In home icon camera logo is specified in the documentation, but is missing from the website

*Expected result:* The header should include the camera logo as specified in the documentation, maintaining design consistency - see here [^Requirement_1.png]
